name: Amazing Peanut Soba Noodles
author: Tarrin
summary: This is a deliciously fresh and easy recipe. It is best served cold but can also be served at room temperature. I guarantee you'll be having seconds!
ingredients: 2 teaspoons brown sugar, or to taste
directions: Fill a large pot with lightly salted water and bring to a rolling boil
Ease soba noodles into water and return to a boil
Cook uncovered, stirring occasionally, until noodles are tender yet firm to the bite, 5 to 7 minutes
Drain and rinse with cold water
Heat canola oil in a saucepan over medium heat; add onion, garlic, and ginger
Cook and stir until onions are translucent, 3 to 4 minutes
Add carrots, red bell pepper, and half the scallions to the pan; cook and stir to desired tenderness, 3 to 5 minutes
Mix soy sauce, peanut butter, sesame oil, hot sauce, and brown sugar in a large bowl until peanut butter is incorporated
Add cooked soba noodles, cooked vegetables, and cucumber to the bowl; toss until fully combined with sauce
Add rice vinegar and toasted sesame seeds to the bowl, toss again
Chill for 30 minutes or more; garnish with remaining scallions and serve with lime wedges
